On Wed, 21 Feb 2001, Dinwiddie, George wrote:

> I've been tasked with evaluating WebLogic/VisualCafe and 
> Borland Application Server/JBuilder for J2EE development.
> Making it more difficult, I've not done J2EE development,
> so I have a bit of a learning curve to climb in a very
> short time.  I'm thinking that JUnit might be able to 
> help me accomplish this in the week I've been given.
> 
> Can anyone give me any cheat-sheets for getting started
> very quickly?  Also, any tips or feedback on these tools
> (or suggestions of others, perhaps) would be greatly
> appreciated.

There is an OpenTool available for JBuilder which integrates
JUnit support right into the IDE itself.  It's still in Beta 
(there's one item in it which doesn't work for me yet and which
the tool's author is trying to track down.)  What works, works
great and I'm eager to see the final release.  

http://codecentral.borland.com/codecentral/ccweb.exe/listing?id=15508

-- 
Joi Ellis                    Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies          joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried.  Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
           - Chris Johnson
